docs.title: Index
TUẦN 4 (PHIÊN BẢN CHI TIẾT): ASKING FOR INFORMATION (CÁCH ĐẶT CÂU HỎI)
docs.text: Việc đặt câu hỏi đúng không chỉ giúp bạn lấy được thông tin mà còn thể hiện trình độ Anh ngữ và sự tinh tế trong giao tiếp. Đối với một DevOps Engineer, đây là kỹ năng sống còn để làm rõ yêu cầu, gỡ lỗi (troubleshoot) và hợp tác hiệu quả.

docs.title: PHẦN 1: YES/NO QUESTIONS (CÂU HỎI CÓ/KHÔNG)
docs.text:
Đây là loại câu hỏi đơn giản nhất, câu trả lời thường bắt đầu bằng Yes hoặc No.

1.1. Cấu trúc nền tảng Công thức chung là đảo trợ động từ (Auxiliary Verb) lên trước chủ ngữ (Subject). Trợ động từ + Chủ ngữ + Động từ chính + ... ?

Trợ động từ Ví dụ Do/Does (Thì hiện tại đơn) Do you like coffee? / Does he work here? Did (Thì quá khứ đơn) Did you finish the task? Am/Is/Are (Thì hiện tại tiếp diễn/Câu với "to be") Are you busy? / Is the server running? Was/Were (Thì quá khứ tiếp diễn/Câu với "to be") Was the system down yesterday? Have/Has (Thì hiện tại hoàn thành) Have you pushed the code yet? Will/Shall (Thì tương lai đơn) Will you join the meeting tomorrow? Can/Could/May (Động từ khuyết thiếu) Can you help me? / Could you explain that again? Should/Would (Động từ khuyết thiếu) Should I update the documentation? / Would you like some tea?

1.2. Patterns theo cấp độ và ngữ cảnh

  • Cấp độ 1: Basic / Informal (Cơ bản / Thân mật)

  • Are you okay?

  • Do you have a minute?
  • Is this your book?
  • Can I call you back?
  • Did you see my message?
  • Are you coming to the party?
  • Do you need any help?
  • Is it raining outside?
  • Have you eaten lunch?

  • Can you pass me the salt?

  • Cấp độ 2: Standard / Neutral (Tiêu chuẩn / Trung tính)

  • Are you available for a quick chat?

  • Do you have any questions?
  • Is this seat taken?
  • Have you received my email?
  • Did you get a chance to review the document?
  • Should we schedule a follow-up meeting?
  • Will the report be ready by 5 PM?
  • Is there anything else I can help you with?
  • Does this solution meet the requirements?

  • Are there any objections to this proposal?

  • Cấp độ 3: Formal / Polite / Indirect (Trang trọng / Lịch sự / Gián tiếp)

  • Đây là kỹ năng cực kỳ quan trọng trong môi trường chuyên nghiệp để không bị coi là thô lỗ hoặc quá trực diện.

  • Thay vì hỏi trực tiếp, hãy dùng các cụm từ dẫn dắt:

  • Could you tell me if the new feature is deployed? (Thay vì: Is the new feature deployed?)

  • Do you know if the client has approved the design? (Thay vì: Has the client approved the design?)
  • I was wondering if you have a moment to discuss the project plan.
  • Would you mind telling me if this is the final version of the report?
  • I'd like to know if it's possible to postpone the deadline.
  • Do you happen to know if Mr. Smith is in his office?
  • Could you please confirm if you will be attending the conference?
  • I was hoping you could tell me if this approach is feasible.
  • Would it be possible for you to check if the server is responding?

  • I'm not sure if this is the right time to ask, but are you free for a call later?

  • Cấp độ 4: IELTS 7.0+ & Advanced Conversation

  • Sử dụng câu hỏi Yes/No để dẫn dắt, làm rõ, hoặc thể hiện sự tương tác trong thảo luận (đặc biệt là Part 3).
  • Tag Questions (Câu hỏi đuôi): Dùng để xác nhận thông tin hoặc tìm kiếm sự đồng tình.
    1. The deployment process is fully automated, isn't it?
    2. You've worked with AWS before, haven't you?
    3. This seems like the most logical solution, doesn't it?
    4. He won't be joining the meeting, will he?
  • Negative Questions (Câu hỏi phủ định): Dùng để thể hiện sự ngạc nhiên hoặc để đưa ra một gợi ý.
    1. Don't you think we should run more tests before deploying? (Gợi ý)
    2. Isn't it a bit risky to push this change on a Friday? (Thể hiện sự quan ngại)
    3. Haven't you finished the ticket yet? (Thể hiện sự ngạc nhiên)
  • Clarifying Questions (Câu hỏi làm rõ):
    1. So, are you saying that we need to rewrite the entire module?
    2. If I understand correctly, are you suggesting we switch to a different cloud provider?

docs.title: PHẦN 2: WH- QUESTIONS (CÂU HỎI DÙNG TỪ ĐỂ HỎI)
docs.text:
Đây là loại câu hỏi dùng để lấy thông tin cụ thể, không thể trả lời bằng Yes/No.

2.1. Cấu trúc nền tảng Từ để hỏi (Wh-word) + Trợ động từ + Chủ ngữ + Động từ chính + ... ?

2.2. Patterns chi tiết theo từng Từ để hỏi (Wh-word)

A. WHAT (Cái gì, Gì)

  • Basic / Informal:
  • What's your name?
  • What's this?
  • What time is it?
  • What are you doing?
  • What happened?
  • Professional / DevOps Context:
  • What are the project requirements?
  • What is the deadline for this task?
  • What seems to be the problem?
  • What is the root cause of this bug?
  • What steps did you take to reproduce the error?
  • What tools are we using for this project?
  • What is the current status of the deployment?
  • What are the next steps?
  • What would be the ideal outcome?
  • What are the potential risks of this approach?
  • Advanced / Indirect:
  • Could you tell me what the main objective is?
  • I'd like to understand what led to this decision.
  • Can you clarify what you mean by "technical debt"?

B. WHEN (Khi nào)

  • Basic / Informal:
  • When is your birthday?
  • When can we meet?
  • When did you get here?
  • Professional / DevOps Context:
  • When is the project kick-off meeting?
  • When can we expect the first draft?
  • When was the last successful deployment?
  • When will the server maintenance be completed?
  • When would be a good time to schedule a code review?
  • Advanced / Indirect:
  • Do you have any idea when the update will be released?
  • Could you give me a timeline for when this will be implemented?

C. WHERE (Ở đâu)

  • Basic / Informal:
  • Where are you from?
  • Where is the restroom?
  • Where did you put my keys?
  • Professional / DevOps Context:
  • Where can I find the documentation for this API?
  • Where are the log files located?
  • Where in the code is this function being called?
  • Where is the project repository hosted?
  • Advanced / Indirect:
  • Could you show me where the configuration file is?
  • I was wondering where I could get more information on this topic.

D. WHO (Ai)

  • Basic / Informal:
  • Who is that?
  • Who called me?
  • Who told you that?
  • Professional / DevOps Context:
  • Who is responsible for this module?
  • Who is the project manager?
  • Who has access to the production server?
  • Who should I talk to about this issue?
  • Who approved this change request?
  • Advanced / Indirect:
  • Do you happen to know who is leading this initiative?
  • Can you tell me who to contact for support?

E. WHY (Tại sao)

  • Lưu ý: "Why" có thể mang tính chất vấn, nên cẩn thận khi dùng trong môi trường chuyên nghiệp.
  • Basic / Informal:
  • Why are you laughing?
  • Why is the sky blue?
  • How come you didn't call me? ("How come" là cách nói thân mật của "Why", không cần đảo ngữ).
  • Professional / DevOps Context (Sử dụng các cách nói giảm nhẹ):
  • What was the reason for choosing this database? (Lịch sự hơn: Why did you choose...?)
  • Could you explain the rationale behind this architectural decision?
  • I'm trying to understand why this error is occurring.
  • What's the purpose of adding this extra step in the pipeline?
  • For my own understanding, why do we need to use this specific library?
  • Advanced / Indirect:
  • I was wondering about the motivation for this change.
  • Could you walk me through the thought process that led to this solution?

F. WHICH (Cái nào - Dùng khi có sự lựa chọn giới hạn)

  • Basic / Informal:
  • Which one do you want?
  • Which color do you prefer, red or blue?
  • Professional / DevOps Context:
  • Which cloud provider are we using, AWS or Azure?
  • Which version of the library should I install?
  • Of these three options, which one is the most cost-effective?
  • Which server is experiencing high latency?

G. HOW (Như thế nào, Bằng cách nào)

  • How (Manner):
  • How does this feature work?
  • How can I fix this bug?
  • How do we optimize this query?
  • How can we improve our deployment frequency?
  • How + Adjective/Adverb:
  • How long will the migration take?
  • How often do you run backups?
  • How many virtual machines do we need?
  • How much memory is the process consuming?
  • How soon can you get this done?
  • How (Opinion/Suggestion):
  • How do you feel about this plan?
  • How about we refactor this code first?
  • What about using a different monitoring tool?

docs.title: TỔNG HỢP TUẦN 4: CẤU TRÚC VÀ TỪ VỰNG CHỦ CHỐT
A. TỔNG HỢP CẤU TRÚC & MẪU CÂU CHÍNH
docs.text:
• Cấu trúc câu hỏi Yes/No: Trợ động từ + S + V ... ?
  • Cấu trúc câu hỏi Wh-: Wh-word + Trợ động từ + S + V ... ?
  • Cụm từ bắt đầu câu hỏi Gián tiếp / Lịch sự:
  • Could you tell me if/what/where...
  • Do you know if/when/who...
  • I was wondering if/why...
  • Would you mind telling me if/how...
  • Do you happen to know...
  • Could you please confirm...
  • Câu hỏi đuôi (Tag Questions): ..., isn't it? / ..., haven't you? / ..., will they?
  • Câu hỏi Phủ định (Negative Questions): Don't you think...? / Isn't it...?
  • Câu hỏi Chuyên nghiệp (DevOps Context):
  • What are the requirements/the deadline/the root cause?
  • When will the maintenance be completed?
  • Where can I find the documentation?
  • Who is responsible for this module?
  • What was the reason for this decision? (Lịch sự hơn "Why")
  • How can we optimize/improve/fix this?
  • How long/often/many/much...?

docs.title: B. TỔNG HỢP TỪ VỰNG & CỤM TỪ HỮU ÍCH
docs.text:
• Từ để hỏi (Question Words):
  • What, When, Where, Who, Whom, Whose, Why, Which, How
  • Trợ động từ (Auxiliary Verbs):
  • Do, Does, Did
  • Am, Is, Are, Was, Were
  • Have, Has, Had
  • Will, Shall, Would, Should, Can, Could, May, Might, Must
  • Động từ dùng để hỏi (Verbs for Asking):
  • to ask (hỏi)
  • to inquire (hỏi, trang trọng)
  • to request (yêu cầu)
  • to confirm (xác nhận)
  • to clarify (làm rõ)
  • to verify (xác minh)
  • to elaborate on (giải thích thêm về)
  • Danh từ chuyên ngành (Technical Nouns from Examples):
  • requirement (yêu cầu)
  • deadline (hạn chót)
  • root cause (nguyên nhân gốc rễ)
  • error / bug / issue / problem (lỗi)
  • documentation (tài liệu)
  • repository (kho chứa code)
  • deployment (việc triển khai)
  • maintenance (bảo trì)
  • configuration (cấu hình)
  • proposal (bản đề xuất)
  • approach / solution (phương pháp / giải pháp)

docs.title: Index
docs.text:
Chắc chắn rồi. Đây là bài học cực kỳ chi tiết cho Tuần 5, tập trung vào chủ đề "My Daily Routine".

Bài học này sẽ cung cấp cho bạn một kho tàng mẫu câu và từ vựng, từ những hành động nhỏ nhặt nhất đến việc mô tả một ngày làm việc của DevOps Engineer. Chúng ta sẽ đi sâu vào Thì Hiện tại đơn và cách dùng Trạng từ tần suất để bạn có thể mô tả thói quen của mình một cách chính xác, tự nhiên và chuyên nghiệp.

Học kỹ bài này, bạn sẽ hoàn toàn tự tin khi nói về chủ đề này trong cả giao tiếp hàng ngày và IELTS Speaking Part 1.

docs.title: TUẦN 5 (PHIÊN BẢN CHI TIẾT): MY DAILY ROUTINE (THÓI QUEN HÀNG NGÀY)
PHẦN 1: NỀN TẢNG NGỮ PHÁP (THE GRAMMAR FOUNDATION)
docs.text:
Trước khi vào các mẫu câu, chúng ta phải nắm vững 2 công cụ ngữ pháp chính của chủ đề này.

1.1. Thì Hiện tại đơn (The Simple Present Tense)

  • Cách dùng: Dùng để diễn tả:
  • Thói quen, hành động lặp đi lặp lại (Habits, Routines): I check my email every morning.
  • Sự thật hiển nhiên, chân lý (General Truths, Facts): The Earth revolves around the Sun.
  • Lịch trình, thời gian biểu (Schedules, Timetables): The train leaves at 7 AM.
  • Công thức:
  • Khẳng định (+):
    • I / You / We / They + V (nguyên thể) -> I work from home.
    • He / She / It + V-s/es -> She starts work at 9 AM.
    • Quy tắc thêm 's/es':
    • Thêm 'es' cho các động từ kết thúc bằng -o, -s, -z, -x, -ch, -sh (Vd: go -> goes, watch -> watches, wash -> washes).
    • Động từ kết thúc bằng 'y', nếu trước 'y' là phụ âm, đổi 'y' thành 'i' rồi thêm 'es' (Vd: study -> studies, cry -> cries).
    • Các trường hợp còn lại thêm 's'.
  • Phủ định (-):
    • I / You / We / They + do not (don't) + V -> I don't drink coffee.
    • He / She / It + does not (doesn't) + V -> He doesn't skip breakfast.
  • Câu hỏi (?):
    • Do + I / you / we / they + V ... ? -> *Do you take the bus?*
    • Does + he / she / it + V ... ? -> *Does she work on weekends?*

1.2. Trạng từ tần suất (Adverbs of Frequency)

  • Chức năng: Cho biết mức độ thường xuyên của một hành động.
  • Thang đo tần suất (The Frequency Ladder):
Tần suất Trạng từ Ví dụ 100% always I always wake up at 6 AM. 90% usually, normally, generally I usually have bread for breakfast. 80% frequently, often I often read books before bed. 50% sometimes, occasionally I sometimes work from home. 10-30% seldom, rarely, hardly ever I rarely watch TV. 0% never I never drink soda.
  • Vị trí trong câu (Position in a Sentence):
  • Quy tắc 1: Đứng TRƯỚC động từ thường.
    • I always check my emails first.
    • He never forgets to set his alarm.
  • Quy tắc 2: Đứng SAU động từ "to be" (am/is/are).
    • I am always on time.
    • The servers are normally stable.
  • Quy tắc 3: sometimes, usually, occasionally có thể đứng ở đầu câu hoặc cuối câu để nhấn mạnh.
    • *Sometimes, I go for a walk after dinner.*
    • I feel tired sometimes.

docs.title: PHẦN 2: XÂY DỰNG CÂU CHUYỆN VỀ MỘT NGÀY (BUILDING THE NARRATIVE OF A DAY)
docs.text:
Dưới đây là hàng loạt mẫu câu để bạn mô tả chi tiết một ngày của mình.

2.1. The Morning Routine (Thói quen buổi sáng)

  • Waking Up (Thức dậy):
  • I always wake up at 6 AM.
  • My alarm usually goes off at 6:30 AM.
  • I'm an early bird, so I naturally wake up around 5:30 AM.
  • I'm not a morning person at all, so I often hit the snooze button a few times.
  • The first thing I do after waking up is check my phone for any urgent notifications.
  • I try to get out of bed as soon as my alarm rings.
  • Getting Ready (Chuẩn bị cá nhân):
  • After getting up, I head straight to the bathroom.
  • I brush my teeth and wash my face.
  • I usually take a quick shower in the morning to feel refreshed.
  • Then, I get dressed for work.
  • I generally pick out my clothes the night before to save time.
  • Breakfast (Ăn sáng):
  • I never skip breakfast.
  • I believe breakfast is the most important meal of the day.
  • I usually have something simple like toast and eggs.
  • I sometimes grab a banh mi on my way to work.
  • I always have a cup of black coffee to kick-start my day.
  • While having breakfast, I often listen to a podcast or read the news.
  • Commuting (Đi làm):
  • I leave for work at around 8 AM.
  • It usually takes me about 30 minutes to get to the office.
  • I commute to work by motorbike.
  • The traffic is often quite heavy in the morning.
  • I rarely take the bus because it's quite inconvenient for me.
  • During my commute, I usually listen to music to relax.

2.2. The Workday Routine (Thói quen tại nơi làm việc - Dành cho DevOps)

  • Starting the Workday (Bắt đầu ngày làm việc):
  • I get to the office at around 8:30 AM.
  • The very first thing I do is turn on my computer and check my emails.
  • I usually spend the first 30 minutes replying to urgent messages on Slack and planning my tasks for the day.
  • I always make a to-do list to keep myself organized.
  • Our team has a daily stand-up meeting at 9 AM sharp.
  • In the stand-up, we briefly share what we did yesterday, what we'll do today, and if we have any blockers.
  • Core Activities (Các công việc chính):
  • I spend most of my day writing and reviewing code.
  • My primary responsibility is to maintain our CI/CD pipelines.
  • I often work on automating infrastructure tasks using Terraform.
  • I frequently collaborate with the development team to troubleshoot and resolve bugs.
  • I sometimes have to investigate performance issues in the production environment.
  • I usually monitor our system's health using tools like Prometheus and Grafana.
  • I rarely have meetings in the afternoon, so I can focus on deep work.
  • I'm in charge of managing our Kubernetes clusters.
  • I occasionally write technical documentation for the new features we implement.
  • I always try to stay up-to-date with the latest technologies in the DevOps space.
  • Lunch Break (Nghỉ trưa):
  • I usually take a one-hour lunch break at noon.
  • I sometimes eat lunch at my desk if I have a tight deadline.
  • I often go out for lunch with a few of my colleagues.
  • We normally go to a small restaurant near the office.
  • Ending the Workday (Kết thúc ngày làm việc):
  • I usually wrap up my work at around 6 PM.
  • Before leaving, I always check my progress against my to-do list.
  • I spend the last 15 minutes planning my tasks for the next day.
  • I try to leave the office on time to maintain a good work-life balance.

2.3. The Evening Routine (Thói quen buổi tối)

  • After Work Activities (Hoạt động sau giờ làm):
  • After work, I usually head straight home.
  • I often hit the gym for about an hour to de-stress.
  • Sometimes, I hang out with my friends for dinner or a coffee.
  • The first thing I do when I get home is change into some comfortable clothes.
  • Dinner and Leisure Time (Bữa tối và thư giãn):
  • My family and I usually have dinner together at around 7:30 PM.
  • After dinner, I often help with the dishes.
  • I like to unwind by watching a TV series on Netflix.
  • I spend an hour or two every evening learning new things or working on my personal projects.
  • I try to read for at least 30 minutes before going to sleep.
  • Bedtime (Đi ngủ):
  • I normally get ready for bed at around 11 PM.
  • I always set my alarm for the next morning.
  • I usually hit the hay / hit the sack (thành ngữ: đi ngủ) at around 11:30 PM.
  • I try to get at least 7 hours of sleep every night to stay productive.

docs.title: PHẦN 3: IELTS 7.0+ - NÓI VỀ THÓI QUEN VỚI SỰ TINH TẾ
docs.text:
Để đạt điểm cao, bạn cần thể hiện nhiều hơn là chỉ liệt kê.

  • Comparing Weekdays and Weekends (So sánh ngày thường và cuối tuần):
  • My daily routine on weekdays is pretty hectic, but I tend to take it easy on weekends.
  • Unlike my structured weekdays, my weekends are usually quite spontaneous. I don't have a fixed plan.
  • While my weekdays are all about work, my weekends are reserved for family, friends, and hobbies.
  • Expressing Feelings about Routines (Bày tỏ cảm xúc về thói quen):
  • To be honest, I'm a creature of habit, so I find having a routine quite comforting and productive.
  • I think having a solid routine helps me stay disciplined and achieve my goals.
  • Sometimes, my daily schedule can feel a bit monotonous, so I try to do something different on the weekends to break the monotony.
  • Describing an "Ideal" Routine (Mô tả thói quen lý tưởng):
  • If I had complete control over my schedule, my ideal routine would involve more time for reading and outdoor activities.
  • In a perfect world, I would start my day with meditation instead of checking my phone.
  • Using More Sophisticated Vocabulary (Dùng từ vựng nâng cao):
  • Instead of "start my day", use "commence my day".
  • Instead of "finish my work", use "conclude my tasks" or "wrap up my day".
  • Instead of "a busy routine", use "a hectic schedule".
  • Instead of "a boring routine", use "a monotonous schedule".
  • "I'm a creature of habit" (Tôi là người sống theo thói quen).
  • "Break the monotony" (Phá vỡ sự đơn điệu).

A. TỔNG HỢP NGỮ PHÁP
docs.text:
• Thì Hiện tại đơn:
  • S + V/V-s/es (Khẳng định)
  • S + don't/doesn't + V (Phủ định)
  • Do/Does + S + V ... ? (Câu hỏi)
  • Vị trí Trạng từ tần suất:
  • Trước động từ thường (I often read).
  • Sau động từ 'to be' (I am never late).

docs.text:

  • 90%: usually, normally, generally
  • 80%: often, frequently
  • 50%: sometimes, occasionally
  • 10-30%: rarely, seldom, hardly ever
  • 0%: never
